DOC.brief_summary: This study acceptability feasibility study two adjunctive intervention : group education stretch ; group acupuncture . The study population woman primary fibromyalgia previously use acupuncture last 3 month . Both intervention 10 week length conduct Oregon Health & Science University . The primary hypothesis arm acceptable feasible study population .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Having meet American College Rheumatology ( 1990 ) criterion diagnosis fibromyalgia 2 . Having primary Traditional Chinese Medicine ( TCM ) diagnosis either Liver Qi Stagnation , Qi Blood Stagnation , Qi Blood Deficiency 3 . Female gender 4 . Reported average pain 5 high last week scale 0 10 ten indicate high pain . 5 . Willingness limit introduction change medication treatment modality control fibromyalgia symptom study 6 . No TCM last 3 month ( include acupuncture , Chinese herb herbal tea pill , tuina ( Chinese massage ) , shiatsu ( Japanese massage ) , qigong Oriental food therapy ) 7 . Ability travel intervention test site two time weekly 8 . Being 18 75 year age , 9 . Capability give informed consent . 1 . Presence known coagulation abnormality , thrombocytopenia , bleed diathesis may preclude safe use acupuncture ; 2 . Individuals celiac disease 3 . A score great 29 Beck Depression Inventory 4 . Presence concurrent autoimmune disease rheumatoid arthritis , systemic lupus erythematosus , inflammatory bowel disease , cause pain could potentially confound analysis ; 5 . Routine daily use narcotic analgesic history substance abuse ; 6 . Concurrent participation therapeutic trial ; 7 . Pregnant nursing mother ( verification pregnancy status determine via urine test ) ; 8 . Severe psychiatric illness ( current schizophrenia , major depression suicidal ideation , substance abuse within two year ) ; 9 . Are undergoing disability determination , involve litigation relate fibromyalgia 10 . Any impairment , activity situation judgment PI would prevent satisfactory completion study protocol 11 . Cognitive behavioral therapy last 6 month . 12 . Nonfluency English
